Course Name: ACG 3101 - FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING AND REPORTING I
Prerequisites:
ACG 2021 -- WITH A MINIMUM "B" GRADE AND
ACG 2071 -- WITH A MINIMUM "B" GRADE
Course Description: COVERS THE THEORETICAL STRUCTURE OF FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING, REQUIRED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, REVENUE RECOGNITION, OPERATING ASSETS, AND CURRENT LIABILITIES.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
STUDENTS WILL BE ABLE TO APPLY ECONOMIC REASONING, ACCOUNTING CONCEPTS, AND GENERALLY ACCEPTED
ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLES TO SOLVE PROBLEMS RELATING TO: INCOME MEASUREMENT AND PROFITABILITY
ANALYSIS, CURRENT AND LONG-LIVED ASSETS, AND CURRENT AND CONTINGENT LIABILITIES.
Textbook(s):
INTERMEDIATE ACCOUNTING  IFRS INTEGRATED BY SPICELAND, SEPE, AND NELSON, 6TH EDITION,
MCGRAW-HILL IRWIN, 2010 (ALSO USED IN FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING AND REPORTING 2)
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
